questions.text: When was the Constitution of India adopted?
questions.explanation:
The Constitution of India was adopted on November 26, 1949.
It came into force on January 26, 1950 (Republic Day).

questions.text: Who is known as the 'Father of Indian Constitution'?
questions.explanation:
Dr. B.R. Ambedkar is known as the 'Father of Indian Constitution'.
He was the Chairman of the Drafting Committee.

questions.text: How many fundamental rights are there in the Indian Constitution?
questions.explanation:
There are 6 fundamental rights in the Indian Constitution.
Originally there were 7, but Right to Property was removed.

questions.text: Who is the current President of India?
questions.explanation:
Droupadi Murmu is the current (15th) President of India.
She is the first tribal President of India.

questions.text: What is the maximum strength of Lok Sabha?
questions.explanation:
The maximum strength of Lok Sabha is 552 members.
Currently, there are 543 members.

questions.text: Who is the head of the Indian Government?
questions.explanation:
The Prime Minister is the head of the Indian Government.
The President is the head of state.

questions.text: What is the term of Lok Sabha?
questions.explanation:
The term of Lok Sabha is 5 years.
It can be dissolved earlier by the President.

questions.text: Who is the Chairman of Rajya Sabha?
questions.explanation:
The Vice President of India is the Chairman of Rajya Sabha.
Rajya Sabha is the upper house of Parliament.

questions.text: Where is the Supreme Court of India located?
questions.explanation:
The Supreme Court of India is located in New Delhi.
It is the highest court in India.

questions.text: Who was the first President of India?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Rajendra Prasad was the first President of India.
He served from 1950 to 1962.
